greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: In the ranked poset of integer partitions ordered by refinement, row n lists the Heinz numbers of integer partitions finer (less) than or equal to the integer partition with Heinz number n.
comment: The Heinz number of an integer partition (y_1, ..., y_k) is prime(y_1) * ... * prime(y_k).
If x and y are partitions of the same integer and it is possible to produce x by further partitioning the parts of y, flattening, and sorting, then x <= y.
example: The partitions finer than or equal to (2,2) are (2,2), (2,1,1), (1,1,1,1), with Heinz numbers 9, 12, 16, so the 9th row is {9, 12, 16}.
results.author: _Gus Wiseman_, Jul 22 2018
